Name: xu duan
續斷
Botanical: Dipsacus asperoides, C. Y. Cheng et TM Ai

Geography: middle and southern parts of China
Maladies Treated: Chronic pain in the loin and knees due to shenxu (kidney deficient)
Swelling and pain of the four limbs (四肢腫痛)
Carbuncles and hemorrhoidal swelling with toxin (癰痔腫毒)
Medical Function: Alleviates contraction of the uterus; calming the fetus (安胎)
Protects from lacking of vitamin E
Helps uterus to grow and develop after removal of the ovaries
Dosage: 10 to 20 g. Concentrated extract: 0.5 to 2 g.
Samples of Formulae: For stabilizing pregnancy: gu shen an tai yin (固腎安胎飲) – for preventing miscarriage (防流產).
Contraindications:
Use carefully in cases of yinxu (yin deficient) with deficient Fire.
There are reports mentioning that some patients developed rash, wheals, and itchiness (allergic reaction).
Research:
Decoction of Chuan xu duan (川續斷) reversed osteoporosis in ovariectomized rats.

On the uterus in vivo: reduces contraction amplitude and tension; shows a tocolytic effect (安胎作用).

Immune function: the water decoction increased hypoxia tolerance in mice, prolonged load-bearing swimming duration in mice, and promoted the phagocytic function of mouse macrophages.

Shows inhibitory action against diplococcus pneumoniae (Streptococcus pneumoniae).

Anti–vitamin E deficiency effect.

Kills Trichomonas vaginalis at a concentration of 0.4 mg/ml.

Promotes uterine development: facilitated growth and development of the uterus in ovariectomized mice.
Chemical Ingredients: Hederagenin [1], Akebia saponin D [2], 3-O-{4-O-acetyl}-alpha-L-arabinopyranosyl-hederagenin-28-O-beta-D-glucopyranosyl-{1-->}-beta-D-glucopyranoside, 3-O-alpha-L-arabinopyranosyl-oleanolic acid 28-O-beta-D-glucopyranosyl-(1-->6)-beta-D-glucopyranoside [3], 3-O-beta-D-glucopyranosyl (1-->3-alpha--L-rhamnopyranosyl (1 -- >2 -) alpha-L-arabinopyranosylhederagenin 28-O-beta-D-glucopyranosyl (1 -->6)-beta-D-glucopyranosyl ester, 3-O-alpha--rhamnopyranosyl (1-->3)-beta-D-glucopyranosyl (1-->3)-alpha-L-rhamnopyranosyl )1 --> 2)-alpha-L-rabinopyranosyl hederagenin 28-O-beta-D-glucopyranosyl (1-->6)-beta-D-glucopyranosyl ester [4], 3-O-[beta-D-xylopyranosyl (1-->4)-beta-D-glucopyranosyl (1-->4)] [alpha-L-rhamnopyranosyl (1-->3)]-beta-D-glucopyranosyl (1--3)-alpha-L-rhamnopyranosyl (1--2)-alpha-arabinopyranosyl-hederagenin, 28-O-beta-D-glucopyranosyl(1-->6)-beta-D-glucopyranosyl ester [5], 3-O-[beta-D-glucopyranosyl (1--4][alpha-L-rhamnopyranosyl (1-->3)]-beta-D-glucopyranosyl (1-->3)-alpha-L-rhamnopyranosyl (1-->2)-arabinopyranosyl-hederagenin, 28-O-beta-D-glucopyranosyl (1-->6)-beta-D-glucopyranosyl ester, 3-O-[beta-D-xylopyranosyl (1-->4)-beta-D-glucopyranosyl (1-->4)][alpha-L-rhamnopyranosyl (1-->3)]-beta-D-glucopyranosyl (1-->3)-alpha-L-arabinopyranosyl (1-->2-alpha-L-rhamnopyranosoyl)-oleanolic acid 28-O-beta-D-glucopyranosyl (1-6) beta-D-glucopyranosyl ester [6], asperosaponin A, C, E, F, G, H1, H2 [9]. [Dipsacus japonocus]

Ethylproprionate, 2-Methyl-3-propyl-trans-oxirane, Toluene, Diisobutyl ether, alpha-Pinene, beta-Pinene, 2, 4-Dimethyl-2, 3-heptadien-5-yne, Phenol, 1, 3, 3, -trimethyl-2-oxabicyclo octane, 1-methyl-4-(1-methylethemyl)-(S)-cyclohexene, 2-methyl-phenol, 3-methyl-phenol, 4-methyl-phenol, 1, 2-dimethoxyl-benzene, 2, 4-dimethyl-phenol, Naphthalene, 4-methyl-l-(1-methyl ethyl)-(R)-3-cyclohexen-1-ol, 4-ethyl-1, 3-benzenediol, a, a, 4-trimethyl-3-cyclohexene-1-methano14-deceylresorcinol, 3-ethyl-5-methyl-phenol, 2, ethyl-04-methyl-phenol, 4-ethyl-2-methoxy-phenol, 4-allyl-2-methoxy-phenol, 4-Cyclopentene-1, 3-dione 4-(3-methyl-2-butenyl)-, Bicyclo2 2 oct -2-ene, 2'-Hydroxy-4'-methoxyacetophenone, Dibenzofuran, 2, 6-bis (1, 1-dimethyl ethyl}-4-methyl-phenol, 2, 4, 6-tri-t-butyl-phenol, 9H-fluorene, 3-ethyl-tridecane, Carvotanecaneton, Heptadecane, PHenanthrene, 6, 9-Octadecadoumpoc acod ,etju; ester, 8, 13---Epoxy-5beta, 8beta, 9beta, H, 10alpha-labd-14-ene, 3, 7, 11-trimethyl-14-(1-methyl ethyl)-S-(E, A, E, E)-1, 3, 6, 10-cyclotertxadecatetraene, 1, 2, 3, 4, 4A, 9, 10, 10A-octahydro-1, 1, 4A -trimethyl-7-(1-methyl ethyl )-, (4AS transe)-phenanthrene, (Z,.Z)-9, 12-octadecadienoic acid, N-phenyl-2-naphthalenamine [11].

xu duan 
        續斷      
 (in English and Chinese 中英文)
 


        by: Joe Hing kwok Chu



Present Day Appication:
            現 代 應 用 ﹕



miscarriage with bleeding.
treatment of soft tissue injuries

 

治療先兆性 流產。
治療軟組織損傷。





Pharmaceutical Name:
英文藥名﹕

Dipsaci Radix



Botanical name:
學名﹕

Dipsacus asperoides, C. Y.Cheng et 
            TM Ai



Pron. in Japanese:
日語發音﹕

zokudan



Pron. in Korean:
韓語發音﹕

sokdan





            Pron. in Cantonese:
粵音﹕

zuk6  dyun6



Other Names:
別名﹕

liu han 六汗, chuan duan 川斷。



Common Name:
英文名﹕

dipsacus



Distribution:
產地﹕

middle and southern parts of China.分 
            佈 華中﹐華南等地。




Properties
(characteristics)﹕
性味﹕

bitter, 
            acrid, slightly warm.
味苦、辛，性微溫。




Channels (meridians) entered:
 
歸經﹕

liver, kidneys.入肝、腎二經。



Medical functions:
藥理﹕
 



inhibits and reverse osteoporosis, 
promotes healing of injured bones
alleviates the contraction of the uterus, thus calming the fetus
improves immune system
inhibits diplococcus pneumoniae 
protects from lacking of vitamin E
kills
              
              Trichomoniasis 
helps uterus to grow and develop: helped the uteri of mice to 
              continue to grow and devlop after removal of their ovaries.

 

抗骨 質 疏鬆作用:  川續斷 水煎液對去卵巢大鼠之骨 質疏鬆,可以使之逆轉
              。
促進骨損 傷 愈合  
對子宫的作用﹕對在體 子宫的作用：，降低其收缩幅度和張力；安胎作用。
对免疫功能的影响  川续断水煎液能提高小鼠缺氧能力，延長小鼠负重游泳持 續 
              時間，促進小鼠巨噬细胞的吞噬功能。
對肺炎雙球菌有抑制作用
抗维生素E缺乏症，



              殺滅陰道毛滴虫（ 
              濃 度 為 0.4mg/ml）的作用﹐
促進子宮發育﹕促進去卵巢小鼠子宮生長發育。

 




Actions 
            & Indications:
主治﹕

For: chronic 
            pain in loin and knees due to 
shenxu (kidney deficient), 
            physical injuries, heavy bleeding during menses, pain during menses, 
            heavy vaginal bleeding (not during menses), abdomen pain,
            vaginal discharge, 
            hemorrhoids.
 腎虛腰
            膝痠痛﹐
            跌打損傷，四肢腫痛﹐月經過多﹐月經痛﹐崩漏﹐腹痛﹐帶
            下﹐遺精﹐ 癰痔腫毒。

            ingredients:

            D[2], [3-O-{4-O-acetyl}-alpha-L-arabinopyranosyl-hederagenin-28-O-beta-D-glucopyranosyl-{1-->}-beta-D-glucopyranoside], 
            [3-O-alpha-L-arabinopyranosyl-oleanolic acid 28-O-beta-D-glucopyranosyl 
            -(1-->6)-beta-D-glucopyranoside][3], [3-O-beta-D-glucopyranosyl 
            (1-->3-alpha--L-rhamnopyranosyl (1 -- >2 -) alpha-L-arabinopyranosylhederagenin28-O-beta-D-glucopyranosyl

            ester][4],  [3-O-[beta-D-xylopyranosyl (1-->4)-beta-D-glucopyranosyl

            [28-O-beta-D-glucopyranosyl (1-->6) -beta-D-glucopyranosyl ester], [3-O-[beta-D-xylopyranosyl

            [Dipsacus japonocus]
2. Ethylproprionate, 2-Methyl-3-propyl-trans-oxirane, Toluene, Diisobutyl 
            ether, alpha-Pinene, beta-Pinene, 2, 4-Dimethyl-2, 3-heptadien-5-yne,

            2-methyl-phenol, 3-methyl-phenol, 4-methyl-phenol,1, 2-dimethoxyl-benzene, 
            2, 4-dimethyl-phenol, Naphthalene, 4-methyl-l-(1-methyl ethyl)-(R)-3-cyclohexen-1-ol, 
            4-ethyl-1, 3-benzenediol, a, a, 4-trimethyl-3-cyclohexene-1-methano14-deceylresorcinol, 
            3-ethyl-5-methyl-phenol, 2, ethyl-04-methyl-phenol, 4ethyl-2-methoxy-phenol, 
            4-allyl-2-methoxy-phenol, 4-Cyclopentene-1, 3-dione 4-(3-methyl-2-butenyl)-, 
            Bicyclo2 2 oct -2-ene, 2'-Hydroxy-4'-methoxyacetophenone, Dibenzofuran, 
            2, 6-bis (1, 1-dimethyl ethyl}-4-methyl-phenol, 2, 4, 6-tri-t-butyl-phenol, 
            9H-fluorene, 3-ethyl-tridecane, Carvotanecaneton, Heptadecane, PHenanthrene, 
            6, 9-Octadecadoumpoc acod ,etju; ester, 8, 13---Epoxy-5beta, 8beta, 
            9beta, H, 10alpha-labd-14-ene, 3, 7, 11-trimethyl-14-(1-methyl ethyl)-S-(E, 
            A, E, E)-1, 3, 6, 10-cyclotertxadecatetraene, 1, 2, 3, 4, 4A, 9, 10, 
            10A-octahydro-1, 1, 4A -trimethyl-7-(1-methyl ethyl )-, (4AS transe)-phenanthrene, 
            (Z,.Z)-9, 12-octadecadienoic acid, N-phenyl-2-naphthalenamine[11].
3. [gentianine][12], [beta-sitosterol], [daucosterol][13].




Dosage:
用量﹕

10  to 
            20 g, Concentrated extract: 0.5 to 2 g.
            10～20克；濃縮中藥：0.5～2
            克.




Samples of formulae:
處方舉例﹕

For stabilizing pregnancy:
         
gu shen 
            an tai yin 
防流產：固腎安胎飲



Modern 
            Research:
現代研究﹕

 



Toxicity 
            & Cautions:
毒素與禁忌﹕



Use the herb carefully in cases of
              yinxu (yin deficient)
               with
              deficient Fire 
              
There are reports  mentioning that some patients had developed 
              rash and itchiness.

 

陰虛兼有 
              虛火.旺
              者慎服。 
個別人服後會出現過敏反應﹐表現為皮疹﹐風團﹐瘙痒 。

Last update: Sept 28, 2013; 10 P.m. 
LAH

Name: di huang
sheng di huang
shu di huang
Biological: Rehmannia glutinosa Libosch (huai qing di huang 淮慶地黃) var. huaichingens
Rehmannia lutea Max. var. Purpurea Makino {筧橋地黃)

Maladies Treated: It is being used as a blood tonic  usually for the weakness caused by by tuberculosis, vomiting blood, nose bleeding, coughing blood, bleeding in the uterus
Infectious hepatitis (when combined with gan cao; intramuscular injection or oral application reported clinically)
Open wounds: raw sheng di huang juice applied externally
Medical Function: Strengthens the function of the heart at medium dosages; large doses are toxic for the heart.
Small doses constrict the blood vessels; large doses dilate the blood vessels
Inhibits carbohydrates being converted into blood sugar
Dosage: 10–30 grams per day, boiled with water.
Samples of Formulae:
shi quan da bu tang 十全大補湯.
liu wei di huang wan 六味地黄丸.
zhi bai di huang wan 知柏地黄丸.
Raw sheng di huang juice can be applied to open wounds.
Contraindications:
Use caution when using large dosages. Large doses have shown to be toxic for the heart of frogs.
Sheng di huang: contraindicated in cases of pixu with dampness, in cases of yangxu, and in pregnant women with blood deficiency of pixu or weixu (stomach deficiency).
Shu di huang: less toxic with milder side effects, but generally avoided when spleen and stomach are deficient, with copious phlegm, and when dampness accumulates in the middle jiao.
Possible side effects: diarrhea, abdominal pain, dizziness, weakness, and palpitations.
Research:
Treatment with hot water extracted Lycium barbarum and Rehmannia glutinosa (0.05% and 0.15% for each) for eight weeks protects against necrotic damage, indicated by decreases in plasma ALT and AST activities, and suppresses liver fibrosis by down-regulation of liver inflammation in rats with CCl(4)-induced liver injury. [1]
Treatment of hepatitis: there are clinical reports that di huang and gan cao combined either in intramuscular or oral application have shown that it promotes the recovery of liver function, especially the decrease of ALT was obvious, and there were no local or systemic bad effects.
Hot water-extracted crude gou qi zi (2–5 g/L) and di huang (5–10 g/L) inhibit proliferation and stimulate p53-mediated apoptosis in human hepatocellular carcinoma cells. [2]
Notes:
When di huang has been just prepared by drying, it is called sheng di huang. Sheng means raw.
When di huang has been prepared by steaming together with other herbs, it is called shu di huang. Shu means cooked.
P53 is a protein that is the product of a tumor suppressor gene, regulates cell growth and proliferation, and prevents unrestrained cell division after chromosomal damage (as from ultraviolet or ionizing radiation). The absence of p53 as a result of a gene mutation increases the risk of developing various cancers. (The American Heritage Medical Dictionary)

Purpurea Makino {筧橋地黃)Pron. in Japanese:日語發音：shojio (for sheng di huang). jukujio (for shu di huang)Pron. in Korean:韓語發音：sukchihwang (for shu di huang)saengchihwang (for sheng di huang)Pron. in Cantonese粤語發音：   dei6  wong4; suk6 dei6  wong4; saang1 dei6 wong4Common Name:英文名：rehmanniaDistribution:Properties性味：sweet, bitter. Sheng di huang is cold and shu di huang is warm.甜﹐苦。生地 黃寒。熟地黃溫。Channels (meridians) entered:歸經： heart, kidney, and liver channels.入心﹐腎﹐肝 經。Actions & Indications:主治：It is being used as a blood tonic  usually for the weakness caused by tuberculosis, vomiting blood, nose bleeding,  coughing blood, bleeding in the uterus.一般作為補血藥。用於肺痨衰弱，吐血，鼻血， 咳血，子宫出血。Medical Function:药理： Medium dosages strengthen the function of the heart. Large doses are toxic for the heart. Increases blood pressure. Small doses constrict the blood vessels and large doses dilate the blood vessel. It possesses the characteristics of diuretics. It decreases the blood sugar and  inhibits carbohydrates being converted into blood sugar.treatment with hot water extracted Lycium barbarum and Rehmannia glutinosa (0.05% and 0.15% for each) for eight weeks protects against necrotic damage, indicated by decreases in plasma ALT and AST activities, and suppresses liver fibrosis by down-regulation of liver inflammation in rats with CCl(4)-induced liver injury.[1]Treatment of hepatitis: there are clinical reports that di huang and gan cao combined either in intramuscular or oral application,  have shown that it promotes  the recovery of liver function, especially the decrease of ALT were obvious and there were no local or systemic bad effect.Hot water-extracted crude gou qi zi (2-5 g/L) and di huang (5-10 g/L) inhibit proliferation and stimulate p53-mediated apoptosis in human hepatocellular carcinoma cells.[2] 中等剤量有强心作用。大剤量對心臟有毒。增加血壓。小剤量能收缩血管。大剤量能擴張血管。有利尿作用。降低血糖。能抑制碳水化合物變作血糖。以熱水水提取枸杞子，熟地黃0.05％和0.15％，餵給大鼠可防止四氯化碳導致 肝臟壞死，降低血漿中ALT和AST活動，並抑制肝纖維化[1]。治療肝炎：臨床報道地黃和甘草合用，無論是肌注或口服對傳染性肝炎都有一定作用， 促進肝功能恢復，尤以ALT下降顯著且無局部及全身不良反應。苟杞子（2-5克/升）和地黃（5-10克/升）熱水提取物，能抑制人類肝癌細胞 增殖和促進p53介導的細胞凋亡。[2]Chemical ingredients:化學成份：See chemical ingredients:按此看化 學成份：Dosage:用 量：10 grams to 30 grams per day, boiled with water. Raw sheng di huang juice can be used on open wounds.每日量：10~30克，水煎服。生地黃汁可用 於傷口。Samples of formulae:處方舉例：shi quan da bu tang, 十全 大補湯，liu wei di huang wan 六味地黄丸,  zhi bai di huang wan知柏地黄丸,Modern Research:现代研究：To be loadedCautions:注意：Use caution when using large dosages. Sheng means raw.When di huang has been prepared by steaming together with other herbs, it is called shu di huang. Medical Function: Calms fright and transforms phlegm; clears heat and relieves toxicity (鎮驚化痰，清熱解毒).
Dosage: To take orally in powder form: 0.7–2 g. Chinese measure given: 內服：研末，2～5分.
Samples of Formulae:
Name of formula: Diang Kuang Ma Bao San (癲狂馬寶散).
Application: For treatment of madness, manic anxiety, delirium, and mania caused by hot phlegm (symptoms include high fever, delirium, even epilepsy and resulting in mania), spitting saliva, talking without making sense, fright and insomnia, crying and laughing, and schizophrenia.
Composition (weights in grams): Ma Bao (horse bezoar) 30 g, Hu Po (amber) 3 g, Long Xian Xiang (ambergris) 1 g, Zhen Zhu (pearl; bake with tofu) 0.3 g, Niu Huang (bovine bezoar) 1.5 g.
Preparation: Grind all into fine powder. Bottle 1 g each.
Dosage: Take half bottle each time (0.5 g). If illness is serious, take 1 bottle (1 g).
Additional details from Chinese text: Functions—sedate, resolve phlegm, calm the spirit, settle the will (鎮靜，豁痰，安神，定志). Indications—mental confusion, manic restlessness; phlegm-heat obscuring the Heart orifices with high fever, coma, delirium, possibly convulsions; foaming at the mouth, unclear consciousness, incoherent speech, violent agitation, vexation and restlessness, startled insomnia, crying and laughing without constancy, and schizophrenia. Classical weights given: 馬寶 2兩, 琥珀 1錢, 龍涎香 1錢, 珍珠（豆腐炙）1分, 牛黃5分. Preparation: ground to fine powder, bottled 3分 per bottle. Dosage: mild cases 1/2 bottle (一分半), severe cases 1 bottle (3分).
Contraindications:
Not to use in cases of cold stomach or in damp phlegm.
Warning about authenticity: There are fake ma bao in the market; some are made of cement and some are gastric calculi from other animals used as substitutes. Genuine ma bao mainly contains ammonium magnesium phosphate, whereas fake ma bao mainly contains calcium carbonate.
Research:
Analysis and identification of calculus Equi components: Components of genuine Calculus Equi and false ma bao were analyzed by X-ray diffraction (WAXD). The main components of genuine ma bao are NH4MgPO4·6H2O (struvite), NH4MgPO4·H2O (dittmarite), and MgHPO4·3H2O, whereas the main components of false ma bao are CaCO3 (present as calcite—hexagonal crystal system—and aragonite—orthorhombic crystal system). PMID: 9642387.
Study details (Chinese text): Eight genuine ma bao samples and one fake were analyzed. Instrument: Rigaku D/MAX-RA X-ray diffractometer (Cu target, wavelength λ = 0.1541 nm). Sample-type findings: ‘Oil ma bao’ and ‘brown ball ma bao’ consist of NH4MgPO4·6H2O, NH4MgPO4·H2O, and MgHPO4·3H2O. ‘Grass-striated ma bao’ mainly contains MgHPO4·3H2O with relatively less NH4MgPO4·6H2O. ‘Oval ma bao’ and ‘light-yellow ma bao’ mainly contain NH4MgPO4·6H2O with less MgHPO4·3H2O; ‘gray ma bao’ is similar. ‘Brown-round ma bao’ and ‘red-flake ma bao’ contain NH4MgPO4·6H2O and MgHPO4·3H2O, with overall lower peak intensities, indicating relatively lower contents of these components than in the oval and light-yellow types. The fake sample’s main components were two CaCO3 phases: calcite and aragonite. The authors note that previous literature claiming the main components are magnesium phosphate, calcium carbonate, and magnesium carbonate requires reconsideration based on these findings.
Traditional identification method noted: Place a small amount of powder on tinfoil and heat from below; if the powder quickly agglomerates and emits a horse-urine odor, it is genuine ma bao; if not, it is fake.
Notes:
Pattern explanation—Yinxu with hot phlegm syndrome: cough with sticky white or yellow phlegm (possibly with blood), achy and tight sensation in the chest and flanks, sometimes low-grade fever, poor sleep at night, red tongue with thin yellow coat, slippery and thin rapid pulse.
Pattern explanation—Damp phlegm syndrome: cough with abundant phlegm, chest fullness, nausea, vomiting, dizziness, palpitation.
Pattern explanation—Cold stomach syndrome: stomach ache due to weather turning cold, bodily chill, or eating cold food; feeling cold in the stomach with pain that is alleviated by warmth.
References: [1] 癲狂馬寶散 (衛生部藥品標准中藥成方制劑第三冊 (WS3-B-0669-91))

Zhu Y, Chen Y, Dai L, Liu W. Analysis and identification of calculus Equi components. [Article in Chinese]. Center of Material Analysis, Nanjing University; Jiangsu Institute for Drug Control. X-ray diffraction (WAXD) study of 8 genuine and 1 fake ma bao. Main genuine components: NH4MgPO4·6H2O, NH4MgPO4·H2O, MgHPO4·3H2O; fake: CaCO3 (calcite and aragonite). PMID: 9642387.
Original Text:
ma bao, Complementary and Alternative Healing University

horse bezoar

藥材主產河北，內蒙古，遼寧，吉林，黑龍江，新疆，甘肅，雲南，貴州，西藏等地。




Properties
(characteristics)﹕
性味﹕

cold, 
            salty, slightly bitter and slightly toxic.
性涼，味咸微苦，有小毒。

歸經﹕

heart, liver.
入心，肝二經。



Medical functions:
藥理﹕
 

 



Actions & 
            Indications:
主治﹕

For 
            treatment of epilepsy, 

yinxu (yin deficient), hot phlegm, 
            mania, delusion and losing consciousness, nose bleeding, vomiting blood, 
            or boils.治驚癇癲狂，陰

contains

to

內服：研末，2～5分。




Samples of formulae:

Name of formula: diang kuang ma 
            bao san 
Application: 
            for treatment of madness, manic anxiety, delirium, mania caused by hot 
            phlegm (symptoms include high fever, delirium, even epilepsy and resulting 
            in mania), spitting saliva, talking without making sense, fright and 
            insomnia, crying and laughing, and schizophrenia. 
Composition: 
            ma bao 30 g, hu po 
            3 g, long xian

            zhen zhu（bake

Grind

Dosage: 
            take half bottle each time (0.5 g). If ilness is serious, take 1 bottle 
            (1 g)

藥方名：癲狂馬寶散

功能主冶：鎮靜，豁痰，安神，定志。主神經錯亂， 
            狂躁不安。痰熱蒙蔽心竅，症見高熱、神昏、譫語，甚或痙厥等引起的癲狂，口吐涎沫，神識不清，語言譫妄，瘋狂打鬧，煩躁不安，驚惕失眠，哭笑無常
            ，及精神分裂症等。

組成：馬寶 2兩，琥
            珀 1錢，龍
            涎香 1錢，珍
            珠（豆腐炙）1分，牛黃
5分。

Not 
            to use in cases of

胃寒 
痰濕者忌用。
注意：市場上有偽馬 
            寶。有些是水泥做成的。有些是用其他獸類的胃結石代替的。 真馬寶的主要成份是含磷酸鎂銨而假馬寶主要成份是碳酸鈣。



　[1] 
        癲狂馬寶散(衛生部藥品標准中藥成方制劑第三冊(WS3-B-0669-91))
Note:

Yinxu with hot phlegm syndrome: cough 
        with sticky white or yellow phlegm, may even with blood in phlegm, achy 
        and tight sensation in chest area, sometimes with low grade fever, listless 
        sleep, red tongue with thin yellow fur, slippery and thin pulse.
 
陰虚痰 熱主 
        要症候：咳 嗽，咯吐白黏痰或黃稠痰，甚或痰中帶血，胸脅悶痛 ，時有低熱，夜眠不安，舌紅，苔薄黃，脈細滑數。
 
Damp phlegm 
        syndrome: cough with abundance of phlegm, fullness in chest are, nausea, 
        vomiting, dizziness, palpitation.
 
濕痰主 要症
        候：咳 嗽痰多，胸膈脹滿，嘔吐惡心，或暈眩心悸。
 
Cold 
        stomach syndrome: stomach ache due to weather becoming cold, or the 
        body getting chill, or eating cold food, feeling cold in stomach while having 
        pain, pain become less if getting warmth.
 
胃寒
[Analysis 
        and identification of calculus equi components]
[Article in Chinese]

 Zhu 
        Y,
        
        Chen Y,
        
        Dai L,
        
        Liu W.
Center of Material Analysis, Nanjing University.
Components of the genuine calculus Equi and false ma 
        bao were analyzed by X-ray diffraction. The results indicate that the main 
        components of the genuine ma bao are NH4MgPO4.6H2O, NH4MgPO4.H2O and MgHPO4.3H2O, 
        whereas the main components of the false Mabao is CaCO3.
PMID: 9642387 [PubMed - indexed for MEDLINE]
馬寶成分的分析與鑒別朱育平， 
        陳逸　，戴樂美（南 京大學現代分析中心２１００９３）劉午霞 （江 蘇省藥品檢驗所南京２１０００８）摘要用ｘ射線衍肘（ＷＡＸＤ）方法分析了８種馬寶 
        和１種偽馬寶的成分。結 果表明：馬寶的主要成分是 ＮＨ４Ｍｇ ＰＯ４�６Ｈ２Ｏ、ＮＨ４．ＭｇＯ４和ＭｇＨＯ４�３Ｈ２Ｏ。而假馬寶的主要成分是Ｃａ 
        ＣＯ３。
 

馬寶是一種貴重中藥材，具有鎮驚化痰，清熱解毒之 
        功效。因其是馬的胃腸道中的結石，故主要 成分為無機鹽。傳統鑒別方法是取少量粉末，洒於錫紙上，下面用火烘烤。如粉末很快聚於一處，並發出馬尿氣味，即 
        是 真馬寶。如無此現象即是 偽馬寶。為了確定真偽馬寶的無機鹽成分，本文用ＷＡＸＤ對此進行了分析與鑒別。１實驗部分１．１樣品來源８種來源不同的馬寶 
        和１種 偽馬寶粉末，均由江蘇 省藥品檢驗所提供。１．２儀器日本理學Ｄ／ＭＡＸ－ＲＡ型Ｘ射線衍射儀，Ｃｕ靶（波長λ＝０．１５４１ｎｍ）。２結果和討 
        論真、偽馬 寶的ｘ射線衍射圖分 別如圖１和圖２所示。根據Ｂｒａｇｇ公式（２ｄｓｉｎθ＝λ），由峰位２θ計算出晶面間距ｄ值。將實測ｄ值與ＪＣＰＤＳ 
        （粉末衍射標准 聯合會）卡片對照 來確定樣品中含有的各種成分。因本系列的樣品中含有不止一種成分或物相，故有個別譜線重疊。在此僅以油馬寶為例，將其 
        和偽馬寶的數據分別 列於表１和表２ 內。為了簡便起見，表中僅列出８個譜線值。由譜圖和表內的數據表明：真馬寶和偽馬寶的成分是截然不同的。油馬寶和棕 
        球馬寶是由NH4MgPO4.6H2O, NH4MgPO4.H2O 和 MgHPO4.3H2O,
        所組成。草紋馬寶 中主要成分是ＭｇＨＰＯ４�３
        Ｈ ２Ｏ，而ＮＨ４ＭｇＰＯ４�６Ｈ２Ｏ的含量相對較少一些。卵圓馬寶和淺黃馬寶的譜圖非常相似，主要成分是ＮＨ４ＭｇＰＯ ４�６Ｈ２Ｏ，但ＭｇＨＰＯ
        ４�３ Ｈ２Ｏ較少，灰馬寶也是如此。棕圓馬寶和紅片馬寶的譜圖較為相似，都含有ＮＨ４ＭｇＰＯ４，６Ｈ２Ｏ和ＭｇＨＰＯ４�３ Ｈ２Ｏ。但是這兩個樣品
        的譜圖與卵 圓和淺黃馬寶相比，峰都比較低。這表明：在棕圓和紅片馬寶中ＮＨ４ＭｇＰＯ４�６Ｈ２Ｏ和ＭｇＨＰＯ�３Ｈ２Ｏ的含量 相對較少。偽馬寶的主
        要成分是兩種不 同物相的ＣａＣＯ３，即方解石（六角晶系）和文石（正交晶系）。曾有文獻記載：�馬寶主要成分是磷酸鎂、碳酸鈣、碳 酸鎂等無機鹽。�根
        據本文的分析結果， 這一記載值得商榷。馬寶成分的分析與鑒別@朱育平，陳逸珺，戴樂美，劉午霞$南京大學現代分析中心，江蘇省藥品檢 驗所馬寶，ｘ射線
        衍射，ＮＨ４ＭｇＰＯ４ ，ＭｇＨＰＯ４用ｘ射線衍肘（ＷＡＸＤ）方法分析了８種馬寶和１種偽馬寶的成分。結果表明：馬寶的主要成分是Ｎ Ｈ４ＭｇＰＯ４�６
        Ｈ２Ｏ、ＮＨ４．ＭｇＯ ４ＭｇＨＯ４�３Ｈ２Ｏ。而偽馬 
        寶的主要成分是ＣａＣＯ３。

                Weather Report



    

Disclaimer

Maladies Treated: Summer heat injury with dampness; part used: flower
Diarrhea (including different types of diarrhea, per recipe); part used: flower
Vaginal discharge (bai beng: frequent large-volume white or transparent sticky vaginal discharge); part used: flower
Swelling from impact injuries; part used: flower
Medical Function: Relieve summer heat and transform dampness (jie shu hua shi); part used: flower
Harmonize the middle and strengthen the spleen (he zhong jian pi); part used: flower
Correct pixu condition (脾虛); part used: flower
Dosage: Internal use: decoction 3–9 g; or make into powder; or pound to make juice. External application: appropriate amount, smash and apply.
Samples of Formulae:
For treatment of different types of diarrhea: bian dou hua (hyacinth bean flower) chosen while blooming. Do not wash. Blanch in boiling water. Mix with one pig tenderloin, one green onion, seven pepper corn, and some sauces. Use white flour and the blanching liquid to make ravioli. Bake and take orally. Source: Must Use Food Therapy (必用食治方).

For treatment of heavy white vaginal discharge (bai beng): bian dou hua (hyacinth bean flower) (do not use purple ones). Bake and dry the herb. Grind into powder. Prepare thin rice porridge and add fire rendered salt. Drink on an empty stomach. Source: Miraculously Effective Remedy (奇效良方).
Research: In vitro: A decoction of bian dou huo at 62.5 mg per mL inhibited the growth of Shigella sonnei and Flexner's bacillus.
Notes:
Bai beng: a traditional Chinese medical term describing frequent large amounts of white vaginal discharge resembling cooked rice water or transparent sticky liquid; more common among weak elderly or middle-aged women; can occur in vaginitis, fallopian tube cancer, endometrial cancer, and other diseases.

Fire rendered salt: salt produced by boiling (using fire) to evaporate water, as contrasted with salt produced by sunlight evaporation in areas with abundant sunlight.

bian dou hua, Complementary and Alternative Healing University

bian dou hua 扁 
    豆花  (in English and Chinese 中英文)

Translated 
    by: Joe Hing kwok Chu
 



Pharmaceutical name:
英文藥名﹕


Flos Dolichos lablab




Botanical name:
拉丁生物學名﹕


Dolichos lablab L.




Pron. in Japanese:
日語發音﹕


henzuka




Pron. in Korean:
韓語發音﹕


p'yontuhwa






        Pron. in Cantonese::
粵音﹕


  bin2 
        dau6 faa1




Other Names:
別名﹕


nan dou hua 南豆花




Common Name:
英文名﹕


Flower of Hyacinth Dolichos




Distribution:
產地﹕


Mainly distributed in Liaoning, 
        Hebei, Shanxi, Shaanxi, Shandong, Jiangsu, Anhui, Zhejiang, Jiangxi, Fujian, 
        Taiwan, Henan, Hubei, Hunan, Guangdong, Hainan, Guangxi, Sichuan, Guizhou, 
        Yunnan provinces of China and other places.
主要分佈於遼寧、河北、山西、陝西、山東、江蘇、安徽、浙江、
        江西、福建、台灣、河南、湖北 、湖南、廣東、海南、廣西、四川、貴州、雲南等地。




Properties
(characteristics)﹕
性味﹕


平，甘，淡，無毒。




Channels (meridians) entered:
 
歸經﹕


spleen, stomach, large intestine.
脾，胃，大腸。



Medical functions:
藥理﹕
 



Invitro of 62.5mg per 
        ml of bian dou huo  decoction can inhibit the growth of
        Shigella sonnei,
        
Flexner's bacillus.

每毫升含生藥62.5mg的扁豆花煎液在試管內可抑制宋內氏型、弗氏型痢疾杆菌生 
        長。




Actions & Indications:
主治﹕


To relieve summer heat rid of
        
dampness; to improve digestion and correct 
        pixu condition. For treatment of summer heat injury, dampness, fever, diarrhea, 
        dysentery, vaginal discharge, swelling form impact injuries.
解暑化濕，和中健脾 。主夏傷暑濕，發熱，泄瀉，痢疾，赤白帶
        下，跌打傷腫。




Chemical ingredients:
化學成份﹕





The flower contains:



花含:





proanthocyanidins



原花青甙





flavonoids



黃酮類





anthocyanidins



花青素





conmarins



香豆精







Daly Dosage:
每日用量﹕



Take orally; in decoction 3-9 g, or make 
        into powder or make into juice.
External application: appropriate 
        amount, smash and apply.

內服：煎湯，3-9g；或研末；或搗汁。外用：適量，搗敷。




Samples of formulae:
處方舉例﹕


For treatment of different types 
        of diarrhea: bian dou hua ( choose those while blooming). Do not wash. Blanch 
        in boiling water. Use one pig tenderloin, one green onion. seven pepper 
        corn, some sauces and mix well. Use white floor and make ravioli.  
        Baked. Take orally. "Source: Must Use Food Therapy (必 
        用食治方)"

        For treatment of heavy white vagina discharge （bai 
        beng): bian dou hua  (do not use purple color ones) . bake and 
        dry the herb. Make into powder. Make with thin rice porridge with some 
        fire rendered salt. Drink while stomach is empty. "Miraculously Effective 
        Remedy 奇效良方."


治一切泄痢：白扁豆花正開者，擇淨勿洗，以滾湯瀹過，和小
          豬脊肉一條，蔥一根，胡椒七粒，醬汁拌勻，就以瀹豆花汁和麵, 包作小餛飽，炙熟食 之。《必用食治方》
 


治婦人白
          崩：白扁豆花（紫者勿用）焙乾 扁豆花為末，炒米煮飲入燒鹽，空心服。《奇效良方》。






Modern Research:
現代研究﹕


 




Toxicity & Cautions:
毒素與禁忌﹕


We have not found any information 
        yet.

source of Chinese information: Zhong Hua Ben Cao, Zhong Yao 
    Da Ci Dian
 


中文資料來源：中華本草， 中藥大辭典。
 
Note:
 
Bai beng: is a traditional Chinese 
    medical term describing frequent large amount of vaginal white color discharge 
    like cooked rice liquid or like transparent sticky liquid. This is more common 
    among weak elderly or middle-aged women. It can happen in vaginitis or fallopian 
    tube cancer, endometrial cancer and other diseases.
 
Fire rendered salt: 
    this refers to salt produced by using fire verses those produced by sunlight. 
    In areas where sunlight is abundance, salt are produced by drying sea water 
    or salt lake water. In areas where sunlight is scanty, salt is produced by boiling 
    using fire to evaporate the water.
 
註：
 
白崩：婦女陰道內不時有白色如米泔樣或 
    透明樣黏液流出，量多如崩狀不止者稱白崩。以老年或中年體弱的婦女多見。陰道炎或輸卵管癌症、子宮內膜腺癌等病也會有白崩。
 

燒鹽: 是指用火提煉的鹽。在陽光多的地區一般用陽光曬鹽。在陽光少的地區常用火提煉的。 
    那就是曬鹽。

        LAH

Maladies Treated: Irritability (心烦); part used: tip of sugar cane
Thirst (口渴), including vexation with thirst (心烦口渴); part used: tip of sugar cane
Nausea and vomiting (反胃呕吐); part used: tip of sugar cane
Dry cough due to lung dryness (肺燥咳嗽); part used: tip of sugar cane
Hard stool / dry stool constipation (大便燥结); part used: tip of sugar cane
Hangover / alcohol intoxication (解酒毒); part used: tip of sugar cane
Medical Function: Clears heat and moistens dryness (清熱潤燥)
Contraindications: When the tips of sugar cane become withered/dry, nutrients can be destroyed and may even convert into toxic substances, producing harmful bacteria, viruses, and parasites. Store while still green before freezing to avoid spoilage.
Research: According to pharmacological research, sugarcane (gan zhe) possesses the functions of clearing heat and moistening dryness, stopping cough, clearing phlegm, and descending qi. It can be used for febrile disease injuring fluids, vexation with thirst, retching and vomiting, lung dryness cough, and dry stool constipation, and it can relieve alcohol toxin (hangover).
Notes:
Nutritional profile and preservation: Gan zhe shao (tip of sugar cane) contains 12–13% crude protein, 16 kinds of amino acids, and many types of sugar. Under winter storage conditions, anaerobic fermentation by lactic acid bacteria gradually converts sugars into lactic acid; when lactic acid reaches a certain concentration, it inhibits destruction of nutrients by other microorganisms, preserving green color, juice, and nutritional value. Winter storage of the tips addresses feed scarcity for farm animals in winter and early spring.

Fresh tips contain abundant chlorophyll, amino acids, crude protein, and sugars. When they become withered, these nutrients are destroyed; therefore, they should be stored for winter while still green, before freezing.

Winter storage methods for animal feed: 1) Dig a pit: choose elevated terrain with low groundwater and good sun exposure; dig a rectangular pit 100–150 cm deep and 60–80 cm wide; length is not limited. 2) Build a storage pool using concrete and red bricks. 3) Cover the floor and walls of an abandoned house with plastic film for storage. After chopping the tips, compact them as tightly as possible, cover with agricultural film, and seal with river sand or mud. Do not open before use to maintain an anaerobic environment. After 50–60 days, open for use; open only one spot and remove material in sections and layers. If mold is found, discard the moldy portion; if the tips are yellow‑green, soft, juicy, and have a wine aroma, they are top grade and can be fed directly to cattle, sheep, rabbits, and geese, or mixed with concentrate feed.

Property: sweet and cool/cold.
Chemical Ingredients: Tips (overall): crude protein 12–13% of fresh tip; contains 16 kinds of amino acids and many sugars; large amount of chlorophyll (fresh tips).
Juice of the tips: aspartic acid 37 mg/100 ml.
Juice of the tips: glutamic acid 10 mg/100 ml.
Juice of the tips: serine 12 mg/100 ml.
Juice of the tips: glycine 5 mg/100 ml.
Juice of the tips: histidine 22.6 mg/100 ml.
Juice of the tips: arginine (amount not specified).
Juice of the tips: proline (amount not specified).
Juice of the tips: valine (amount not specified).
Juice of the tips: methionine (amount not specified).

Winter storage process: under anaerobic fermentation by lactic acid bacteria, sugars in the tips gradually convert to lactic acid; lactic acid accumulation inhibits nutrient destruction by other microorganisms.
Further Reading: 中國農民網：甘蔗梢是寶，冬貯養畜好，發布時間：2006-2-14
Original Text:
gan zhe shao, tip of sugar cane, Complementary and Alternative Healing UniversityComplementary and Alternative Healing University  Home  現 代中藥辭典Search this siteList of Health ProblemsChinese Herb DictionaryQigongTraditional Chinese Medicine (TCM)AcupuncturePrescribed Drug DictionaryBiochemistry DictionaryLecture SlidesResearch LibrarianGeneral Online LibrarySearchResearch SitesViagraMassage/AcupressureHypnotherapyTell us what you wantNotify Changes & New Information　　　                                                        gan zhe shao (tip of sugar cane)  甘蔗梢   Compiled and translated by: Joe Hing Kwok Chu    按此看中文 Gan zhe shao (tip of sugar cane) contains 12 to 13% of crude protein, 16 kinds of amino acid and many types of sugar. Under storage condition in winter temperature, due to anaerobic fermentation of lactic acid bacteria, the sugar content gradually turns into lactic acid. When the lactic acid arrives at a certain level, it will inhibit the destruction of the nutrients by other micro organism. Thus the tips of the sugar canes can preserve the green color, the juice and the nutrition value. So, winter storage of the tips of sugar cane is a good method to solve the feed of farm animals for winter and early spring when the feeds are scarce. The fresh tips of sugar cane contain rich nutrition, large amount of chlorophyll, amino acid, crude protein and sugar. When they are wilted, the nutrients can be destroyed. So, it is a good practice to store them for winter when they are still green. Medical Application: for treating irritability, thirst, nausea, vomiting, dry cough, hard stool, hangover from drinking alcohol. Property: cool, sweet. Chemical ingredients of the  juice of the tips of sugar cane:aspartic acid：37mg/100mlglutamic acid： 10mg/100mlserine： 12mg/100mlglycine： 5mg/100mlhistidine：22.6mg/100mlarginineprolinevalinemethionine.  Sponsors' Ads by Google 以下為谷歌所提供贊助者之廣告 甘蔗梢是寶，冬貯養畜好 發布時間：2006-2-14 來源：中國農民網 　甘蔗梢粗蛋白質含量高達12%～13%，含有16種氨基酸和多種糖。在冬貯狀態下，通過乳菌等厭氧發酵，甘蔗梢中的糖分會逐步轉化為乳酸，當乳酸達到一 定濃度時，就會抑制甘蔗梢中的營養成分被其他微生物破壞，從而使甘蔗梢長期保持青綠、多汁，營養價值不會發生太大的變化。因此，冬貯甘蔗梢是解決冬季和初 春家畜缺乏青飼料的好辦法。鮮嫩的甘蔗梢營養豐富，含大量葉綠素、氨基酸、粗蛋白質和糖分。甘蔗梢干枯後，這些營養成分都會遭到破壞，甚至轉化為有毒物質 ，產生大量有害細菌、病毒和寄生虫。因此，應在冰凍前、甘蔗梢尚為青綠色時冬貯。  　　冬貯通常採用三種方法：  　　一是挖窖。要選擇地勢高、地下水位低、向陽的地方挖窖。要挖成長方形，深100～150厘米、寬60～80厘米，長度不限。  　　二是用混凝土和紅磚建池。  　　三是將廢棄的房屋、地面和牆壁用薄膜覆蓋起來進行冬貯。把甘蔗梢切碎後放入貯藏池，千方百計壓緊，越緊越好。最後用農膜覆蓋，用河沙或泥土密封。在取 用前切忌開封，以免破壞厭氧環境。冬貯50～60天後便可開封取用。取用時，隻能打開一處，分段分層取用。啟封後，如發現霉變，則應把霉變部分除去；如果 發現甘蔗梢顏色黃綠、柔軟多汁、有酒香味，則為上等品，可直接飼喂牛、羊、兔、鵝等草食畜禽，也可以添加一些精飼料混合飼喂。 性味：甘甜， 寒。 天然甘蔗梢汁中含有：天門冬氨酸：37mg/100ml ，穀 氨酸： 10mg/100ml，絲氨酸： 12mg/100ml ，甘氨酸： 5mg/100ml，組按酸： 22.6mg/100ml，精氨酸，脯氨酸 ，纈氨酸，蛋氨酸。  經藥理研究，甘蔗具有清熱潤燥、止咳、清 痰、下氣等功用，可用於熱病傷津、心煩口渴、反胃嘔吐，肺燥咳嗽、大便燥結等症，還可解酒毒。 A manuscript... writing, translating and proofreading  in progressClick here for inquiry Copyright Notice 按此看關於版權問題List of Health ProblemsChinese Herb DictionaryToxicity of Some Herbs Side Effect of Some Herbs Herbs that can be toxic to kidneysTraditional Chinese MedicineTCM DiagnosisSamples of FormulaeAcupuncturecopy right 版權所有Qigong (chi kung)Prescribed Drug DictionaryEmail our web master for  your suggestion (not for inquiry)Biochemistry DictionaryGeneral Online LibraryQigong classesFake Email WarningResearch LibrarianSearchQigong classesHomeWeather ReportDisclaimerSearch this site
